meanings.definition: The state of being empty or without contents.
meanings.sent1: The voidness of the box surprised me.
meanings.sent2: The room's voidness made it feel cold and lonely.
meanings.sent3: The voidness of the fridge was a mystery - where did all the food go?
meanings.sent4: Her eyes held a voidness that spoke of deep sorrow.
meanings.sent5: The voidness of the desert stretched endlessly before us.

meanings.definition: The quality or state of being ineffective or useless.
meanings.sent1: The voidness of the plan was evident from the start.
meanings.sent2: His argument was full of voidness, lacking any real substance.
meanings.sent3: The voidness of the broken toy made it clear it was beyond repair.
meanings.sent4: The voidness of his promises left her feeling disappointed.
meanings.sent5: The voidness of the old computer rendered it obsolete.
